data.title: Northern NSW Local Health District
data.meta_description: Byron Central Hospital provides a range of services including emergency services, mental health, birthing and maternity services, and ambulatory and allied health services.
data.text:
Byron Central Hospital provides a range of services including: emergency services, mental health, birthing and maternity services, and ambulatory and allied health services.

Select from the departments and services to learn more.

Visitor Information: From Saturday 8 June, in response to an increase in respiratory viruses circulating in Northern NSW, visitors are encouraged to wear a mask while in clinical areas, and use hand sanitiser.

Getting here

Byron Bay Taxis & Limousines: 24hrs a day. Taxi Transport Subsidy Scheme available. Phone: (02) 6685 5008

Blanchs Bus Service: regular public service with a bus shelter on-site. Route 640 (Blanchs Service) Ballina – Lennox Head – Suffolk Park – Byron Bay – Mullumbimby. Concessions available.

For timetable call (02) 6686 2144 or visit www.blanchs.com.au

Tweed Byron Ballina Community Transport: a not-for-profit service funded to help older people, people with a disability, their carers and others who have difficulty accessing public transport. To book call 1300 875 895 or admin@community-transport.org.au

Byron Shire Respite Services: People requiring assistance can contact the Program coordinator for assessment on (02) 6685 1921

United Protestant Association of NSW Limited (UPA): a Christian care organisation, providing transport assistance.

Phone: (02) 6628 5559 or email: office@upanthcoast.org.

Visiting Hours

24 hours a day, 365 days a week : see individual wards for specific times

Parking information

Free on-site car parking available for patients, clients, and visitors. There are a number of public transport options available to the hospital. See the 'Getting Here' section above.

Drop off zones

Drop off zone is accessible via Ewingsdale Road
